title: Totta bank logo typeface
content:
Does anybody know what font was used in this logo:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130171125im_/http:/typophile.com/files/totta_4892.gif)
author: Marcedo

comments.content: I think it's custom. That 'a' is straight out of Futura Bold but not the t's.

One of those old FontBank fonts called [Migra Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130171125/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/migra.htm) seems to be a good match for this. Those fonts were all based on other typefaces, but I never quite figured out what this was based on. Flyer, that E+F no longer sells (not the same as current Linotype one)?

- Mike Yanega

I see TypeShop is selling an extended family like this that they call [Montreal](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130171125/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/montreal/). The Heavy is exactly like 'Migra Heavy', so I think there is a common origin. (I have noticed that most TypeShop fonts are not original designs, and seem to be from the Brendel collection.)

- Mike Yanega

Thanks, Mike, I suppose Montreal TS Bold would be a close match...

And thanks to you too, Patty, always trying to help everybody!

Jorge Marcedo  
Coimbra | Portugal
